alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 5:43PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Valley. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low water crossings are impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported flooding in Beaver Creek Road on the Larb Creek. This will cause small stream flooding. - Beaver Creek Road on the Larb CreeK is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
